BrianHks wrote:

> There are two things I would like to do with JUnit.
> 1. Run a bunch of tests on a class without junit creating a new
> instance of the class for each test. I know you can use the
> BeforeClass and AfterClass methods to set static data but that is so ugly.

You can use a Singleton for this.

> 2. It would be nice to have a chain of test where if one failed it
> would quit and not run any more. Maybe this is already available. If
> it is please let me know how to do it.

This goes against the basic design of JUnit, which promotes test 
isolation. The only thing I can think of to achieve this is System.exit().
